name: alt-sendme
description: Send files and folders anywhere in the world without storing in cloud - any size, any format, no accounts, no restrictions.
readme_summary: Alt-Sendme is a free, open-source tool for direct peer-to-peer file transfer. It allows users to send any file or folder of any size or format directly between devices without using cloud storage, ensuring end-to-end encryption and privacy.
key_features: No accounts or personal info required
Transfer any file/folder size or format
NAT traversal via QUIC hole punching
primary_use_case: Direct, secure, and private file and folder transfer between devices without relying on cloud services.
cover_image_prompt: A conceptual illustration of two hands, one on the left and one on the right, reaching towards each other across a stylized globe. From the left hand, a stream of diverse digital 'packages' (representing files and folders of various shapes and sizes) flows directly to the right hand. These packages are encased in a subtle, glowing shield of light, symbolizing end-to-end encryption. In the background, faint lines connect various points on the globe, illustrating peer-to-peer networking and NAT traversal without any central cloud icon. The AltSendme logo is subtly integrated into the connection lines. The overall mood is secure, direct, and efficient, rendered in a clean, modern 3D isometric style with a vibrant blue and green color palette.

name: deepseek_ocr_app
description: A quick vibe coded app for deepseek OCR
readme_summary: DeepSeek OCR is a modern web application for Optical Character Recognition, featuring a React frontend and FastAPI backend. It supports processing both individual images and entire multi-page PDF documents, with advanced features like formula and formatting preservation, and allows exporting results into various formats including Markdown, HTML, DOCX, and JSON.
key_features: Multi-Format Document Conversion (Markdown, HTML, DOCX, JSON)
Image OCR (Plain OCR, Describe, Find, Freeform modes)
Real-time Progress Tracking for large documents
Dual mode: Image OCR + PDF Processing
primary_use_case: Digitizing and extracting text and structured data from scanned documents (images and PDFs) into editable and usable digital formats.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old librarian meticulously scanning ancient, dusty scrolls with a futuristic, glowing magnifying glass. The magnifying glass projects beams of light that transform the text from the scrolls into clean, organized digital pages (represented by glowing icons of Markdown, DOCX, and JSON files) floating in the air. The librarian is carefully preserving intricate diagrams and mathematical formulas from the scrolls, which are subtly visible. The background is a cozy, modern library with subtle digital interfaces displaying progress bars and data streams. The overall mood is one of knowledge preservation and digital transformation. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a warm, inviting color palette and clear, readable iconography.

name: gobackup
description: ðŸ—„ CLI tool for backup your databases, files to cloud storages in schedully.
readme_summary: GoBackup is a Go-based CLI tool designed for application servers to automate the backup of databases and files. It supports scheduled backups to various cloud storage services, offering features like encryption, compression, and notifications for a low-maintenance, secure backup solution.
key_features: Archive paths or files into a tar
Split large backup file into multiple parts
Run as daemon to backup in schedully
Notifier support (Mail, Webhook, Discord, Slack, etc.)
primary_use_case: Automating scheduled backups of databases and files to cloud storage for application servers.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent robot butler meticulously organizing and securing various digital treasures (represented as glowing orbs and scrolls) into a vault. The robot is shown transferring these items from different sources (like database icons and file folders) into a large, secure cloud storage icon in the background. Subtle digital particles and a small, unobtrusive GoBackup logo on the robot's chest connect it to the software. The scene is set in a clean, organized digital workspace with soft, ambient lighting, emphasizing reliability and automation. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a friendly, modern aesthetic, clear iconography, and a balanced color palette of blues, greens, and grays.

name: legend
description: Legend builds and publishes Grafana dashboards for your services with prefilled metrics and alerts for your services.
readme_summary: Legend is a tool that automates the creation and publishing of Grafana dashboards for various services and infrastructure components. It preconfigures metrics and alerts based on established methodologies like USE and RED, simplifying the observability setup for developers.
key_features: Build dashboards for services with prefilled metrics
Automatic setup of basic alerts with priority and service mapping
Support for a wide range of components (Airflow, ALB, Kubernetes, MySQL, Nginx, etc.)
Compatibility with Cloudwatch, InfluxDB, Loki, and Prometheus data stores
primary_use_case: Automating the generation and management of Grafana dashboards for monitoring services and infrastructure.
cover_image_prompt: A master craftsman, akin to a legendary artisan, meticulously assembling intricate clockwork mechanisms that represent different services (e.g., a cloud, a database, a server rack). Each assembled part seamlessly clicks into a larger, unified dashboard structure that glows with organized data streams. Small, stylized icons representing metrics and alerts float around the craftsman's workspace. The overall scene is one of organized creation and automated precision, set in a bright, modern workshop with subtle digital overlays. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, vibrant color palette, emphasizing clarity and the transformation of raw components into a cohesive monitoring system.

name: beszel
description: Lightweight server monitoring hub with historical data, docker stats, and alerts.
readme_summary: Beszel is a lightweight, self-hosted server monitoring platform that collects historical data, tracks Docker container statistics, and provides configurable alerts. It features a user-friendly web interface, supports multi-user and OAuth authentication, and offers automatic backup capabilities.
key_features: Docker and Podman container stats (CPU, memory, network)
Configurable alerts for various system metrics
primary_use_case: Self-hosted server and Docker container monitoring with historical data and alerting.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant lighthouse keeper on a cliffside, tending to a powerful beacon that illuminates multiple ships (representing servers and Docker containers) sailing on a calm sea. The beacon's light is composed of streams of data, showing CPU, memory, and network usage. Small, glowing alert icons appear around the ships that are experiencing issues. In the background, a subtle digital overlay shows historical data trends. The lighthouse itself has 'Beszel' subtly etched into its base. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a clear, bright color palette and a focus on the lighthouse as the central element.

name: nginx-ignition
description: An user interface for the nginx web server, aimed at developers and enthusiasts that don't want to manage configuration files manually
readme_summary: nginx-ignition is a Go-based web UI for managing Nginx configurations, designed for developers and enthusiasts. It simplifies the setup and management of virtual hosts, streams, SSL certificates, and server settings through an intuitive interface, offering both direct Nginx control and configuration file generation.
key_features: Integrations with Docker, Docker Swarm, Tailscale, TrueNAS
Option to run Nginx or generate config files
primary_use_case: Simplifying the management of Nginx web server configurations through a user-friendly graphical interface for developers and enthusiasts.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, modern workshop scene where a skilled artisan is assembling a complex, intricate clockwork mechanism representing Nginx. Instead of traditional tools, the artisan uses a sleek, glowing tablet interface displaying intuitive icons and sliders. Gears and components representing virtual hosts, SSL certificates, and proxy streams are being precisely placed. Subtle digital particles and data streams flow from the tablet to the clockwork, indicating configuration being applied. The repository name 'nginx-ignition' is subtly etched onto the artisan's workbench. The overall mood is one of effortless control and creation. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a clean, bright color palette and soft lighting.
